Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio Espinosa-Bonilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release, time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Voucher to DOA for Polk Co Treasurer to pay $252.00 interpretor fees.

Defendant Sergio  Espinosa-Bonilla in court with attorney Kathleen Mary Gionis.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:00 pm.  Interpreter George McGregor also present.  ADA-motion to amend count 1 to misd D/C.  CT-Count 1 amended to misd D/C, 947.01(1).  Def-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.
SENTENCE:  33 days PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Credit for 33 days=time served.  No court costs.  2:24 pm adj.
Pre-trial conference on September 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Information filed.  Gionis-NG plea, DST.  Bond cont.  4:24 pm adj.

Defendant Sergio Espinosa-Bonilla in court with attorney Kathleen M. Gionis.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 4:09 pm.  Interpreter George McGregor appears for def.  CT finds PC, def bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Not to have contact with: Donald Potting and Mr. Potting and his home address of 2494 Old 87 in Cushing Wi.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.

Defendant Sergio Espinosa-Bonilla in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Sergio Espinosa-Bonilla in custody.  Daniel Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 1:12PM Interpreter appeared for defendant (Mr. McGreger) Sworn in.  Interpreter to read PC to Defendant.  Waives further reading.  Defendant has active warrant in Marathon County.  Def qualifies for Public Defender.  Atty will be assigned with atty who speaks Spanish.  Court - goes over CC/Penalites.  JA to schedule Prelim w/i next 20 days with atty. adj.  1:23PM
